intro: Lycopodium somae, commonly known as the Somalian clubmoss, is a rare and ancient plant species belonging to the Lycopodiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, spore-bearing cones and its ability to thrive in arid, rocky environments. The plant exhibits a unique morphological structure with a stem that bears spirally arranged leaves. Lycopodium somae plays a vital role in its ecosystem by contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for microorganisms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
